column1: Proteins have different functions depending on their shape. They can be found in meat or muscle. They are used for growth and repair
column2: as well as for strengthening the bones. They help to make tissue and cells. They are in animals
column6: and also in the human body.Muscles contain a lot of protein. When protein is digested
column7: it is broken down into amino acids. These amino acids can then be used to build new protein. Proteins form an important part in foods like milk
column13: and nuts. There are four factors that determine what a protein will do. The first is the order of the amino acids. There are 20 different types of amino acids. The second is the little twists in the chain. The third is how the entire structure is folded up. The fourth is whether it is made up of different sub-units. Haemoglobin molecules
